title: Tweet by @vercel
description:
Our official Vercel MCP server is now live.

AI clients like Claude and VS Code with Copilot can now read Vercel docs and securely access your projects, deployment logs, and more using OAuth with read-only permissions.

https://t.co/RkIT99WnVS
content_body:
Our official Vercel MCP server is now live.

AI clients like Claude and VS Code with Copilot can now read Vercel docs and securely access your projects, deployment logs, and more using OAuth with read-only permissions.

https://t.co/RkIT99WnVS

title: Tweet by @vercel
description: We're excited to partner with @openai to bring day-1 support for their open models to @aisdk and AI Gateway.
content_body: We're excited to partner with @openai to bring day-1 support for their open models to @aisdk and AI Gateway.

referenced_content.text:
You can now access @openai's new open models through Vercel AI Gateway.

Set the AI SDK v5 ùöñùöòùöçùöéùöï to either 'openai/gpt-oss-20b' or 'openai/gpt-oss-120b' to start building.

Multiple redundant inference providers. No accounts required.
https://t.co/XTv69O6vS5

title: Tweet by @vercel
description:
Fluid makes it possible to ship AI and backend workloads without the gotchas of serverless.

It prevents cold starts, it adds streaming and post-response compute support, and massively improves cost-efficiency.

Here's how we engineered it
https://t.co/6yNSE5tyKb
content_body:
Fluid makes it possible to ship AI and backend workloads without the gotchas of serverless.

It prevents cold starts, it adds streaming and post-response compute support, and massively improves cost-efficiency.

Here's how we engineered it
https://t.co/6yNSE5tyKb

title: Tweet by @vercel
description:
Watch @LubaKravche's Ship 2025 session to learn how Vercel's framework-defined infrastructure simplifies caching and content delivery.

See how it works, the difference between CDN and runtime caches, and a deep dive into revalidation with Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR). https://t.co/CsvhNlPDdm
content_body:
